conbody.p: This section summarizes the architecture description provided by Docker as customized for . For additional information, refer to the Docker site.
Docker provides convenient tools that make use of the cgroups feature of the Linux kernel to develop, distribute, and run applications. Docker internals include images, registries, and containers.

dlentry.dd: Docker images are read-only templates that are used to create Docker containers. Images are easy to build, and image updates are change layers, not wholesale replacements.
Docker registries hold images. uses a private Docker registry for its own images and application images.
Docker containers have everything needed to run an instance of an application, and are created from images.
Docker and data are stored in an LVM thin pool that is created on one or more block devices or partitions or LVM volume groups.
